item.title: Israel intercepts missile from Yemen after airstrikes on Houthi port
item.dc:creator: Andrew Jeong
item.description: Israeli forces said the missile was launched from Yemen a day after Israel struck a Houthi-controlled port there and two days after a rare Houthi attack in Tel Aviv.

item.title: Israel strikes Yemen port after Houthis claim drone attack in Tel Aviv
item.dc:creator: Kareem Fahim, Alon Rom, Steve Hendrix, Mohamad El Chamaa
item.description: Israel’s attack Saturday heralded a further expansion of the war in Gaza, and added a volatile new dynamic to what has become a building regional conflict.

item.title: Toll in Bangladesh protests tops 100 as Dhaka falls quiet under curfew
item.dc:creator: Azad Majumder, Rebecca Tan
item.description: Dhaka and several other Bangladeshi cities have been engulfed by protests in opposition to a new policy reserving a portion of government jobs for certain groups.

item.title: In this city, people say Russia must defeat Ukraine and the West at any cost
item.dc:creator: Francesca Ebel
item.description: The Post visited Kirov, in western Russia, where residents say President Vladimir Putin’s war in Ukraine is a fight for Russia’s survival against the U.S. and NATO.

item.title: Yemen’s Houthis claim drone strike near U.S. Embassy branch in Tel Aviv
item.dc:creator: Heidi Levine, Kareem Fahim, Steve Hendrix, Kelsey Ables
item.description: One person was killed and at least five injured in the attack, which Israeli officials say probably came from Yemen.

item.title: What caused the Windows outages affecting flights, companies around the world
item.dc:creator: Adela Suliman, Dan Rosenzweig-Ziff, Eva Dou, María Luisa Paúl
item.description: Microsoft said it was aware of an issue affecting Windows programs running cybersecurity technology from CrowdStrike. Here’s how flights, hospitals and services were affected.

item.title: Afghanistan War Commission opens inquiry of America’s longest conflict
item.dc:creator: Abigail Hauslohner
item.description: The Afghanistan War Commission will study the conflict’s myriad failures with a mandate to recommend how the U.S. can avoid a repeat performance.

item.title: At least 40 Haitian migrants killed in boat fire
item.dc:creator: Amanda Coletta
item.description: They were heading for Turks and Caicos, the International Organization for Migration said.

item.title: Why do we blush? Research subjects watched their own karaoke to find out.
item.dc:creator: Kyle Melnick
item.description: Participants in a new study blushed while watching videos of themselves singing popular karaoke songs from Adele, Mariah Carey and “Frozen.”

item.title: Bangladesh imposes curfew after dozens killed in anti-government protests
item.dc:creator: Gerry Shih
item.description: Schools and universities have been closed indefinitely, and authorities have cut mobile internet services nationwide, citing the need to curb disinformation.

item.title: Israel should evacuate settlements, pay reparations, ICJ says
item.dc:creator: Loveday Morris
item.description: Israel described the request for the court to weigh in as biased and an “abuse of international law and the judicial process.”

item.title: What the death of leader Nguyen Phu Trong means for Vietnam
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Tan
item.description: Trong presided over a period of greater economic openness and a domestic political crackdown as Vietnam became a swing state in Asia’s great power games.

item.title: Russian court convicts journalist Evan Gershkovich, imposes 16-year sentence
item.dc:creator: Robyn Dixon
item.description: Gershkovich, a Wall Street Journal reporter accredited by Russia’s Foreign Ministry, was arrested in March 2023 in a case his employer called hostage-taking.

item.title: See how Social Security retirement benefits stack up globally
item.dc:creator: Julie Weil
item.description: A look at how the U.S. public pension system stacks up to more than 100 others, in five charts.

item.title: Inside Sudan, devastating warfare forces desperate choices
item.dc:creator: Katharine Houreld, Hafiz Haroun
item.description: A rare trip by Post journalists to five Sudanese cities revealed starvation, mass displacement — and acts of stunning heroism.

item.title: Israel says Gaza war winding down despite rise in deadly civilian strikes
item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger, Hajar Harb, Hazem Balousha
item.description: Palestinians and humanitarian workers have said the wave of recent attacks are similar in intensity and lethality to those in the early weeks of the war.
